Here is one: a list of Jews who lived in the city, compiled in 1935 by the Jewish community, the Jewish historical society, and the rabbinical court. The list includes 1,751 Jews. This is the only known list of Jews who lived in Novogrudok prior to World War II. It includes the street addresses of the families, their occupations, and their ages. In 1941, when the Nazis occupied Novogrudok, they murdered 97 percent of its Jewish residents. The list was recovered from a rubbish heap in Vilna.

Source: Jewish Virtual Library - Jewish Community in Novogrudok
